data.message: The relationship between Formulas and Principles: FORMULAS tell you WHERE (golden ratio sizing, 40% overlap, positioning percentages). PRINCIPLES tell you WHY and help VALIDATE (is there balance? is emphasis clear? does movement flow?). Use formulas to establish baseline, then audit with principles to refine. Neither alone is sufficient - formulas without principles = technically correct but soulless; principles without formulas = conceptually right but imprecise positioning.
